meaningMnemonic:
You <kanji>exit</kanji> a <kanji>facility</kanji>. It's your <vocabulary>release from prison</vocabulary>!

出所 commonly refers to leaving or being released from facilities ending in 所, particularly 刑務所 (prisons). It can also be a slightly formal word for <vocabulary>source</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>origin</vocabulary>, often used in discussions of copyright to specify the origin of cited information, images, or content.
readingMnemonic:
The reading follows on'yomi protocols, but you just have to be careful of the shortened しゅつ which becomes しゅっ.

Note: There is also the reading <reading>でどころ</reading> for the meanings <vocabulary>origin</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>source</vocabulary>. This version is generally used in spoken language, often to emphasize the significance or curiosity about where something came from.
